description: In early afternoon trade, the single currency fell below the $1.04 mark for the first time in 13 years, hitting a low 0f $1.0395 around 1.00 p.m. GMT.
title: Euro versus US Dollar, December 14: BOE, Fed
title_page: Euro versus US Dollar, December 14: BOE, Fed - Business Insider
text:
The euro has dropped to its lowest level against the dollar since 2003 after three consecutive days of drops.
In early afternoon trade, the single currency fell below the $1.04 mark for the first time in 13 years, hitting a low 0f $1.0395 around 1.00 p.m. GMT. It has remained close to that level throughout the afternoon. Here's how it looks at 4.35 p.m. GMT:
Markets Insider
On Wednesday, Federal Reserve hiked its benchmark interest rate, as expected, and upped its expectation for the number of rate hikes in 2017.
This move, which markets saw a 100% probability of, will increase the target of the federal funds rate — which banks use to lend to each other overnight — by 25 basis points, to a range of 0.50 to 0.75%.
Meanwhile, the Bank of England left its key interest rate unchanged at 0.25%, a record low that has been in place since rates were cut in August following the UK's vote to leave the European Union.
